paper_abstract: If G is a graph with n vertices and lambda(1), lambda(2), ..., lambda(n) are its eigenvalues, then the energy of G is defined as E(G) = \lambda(1)\+\lambda(2)\+...+\lambda(n)\. Let G(n) be the set of all unicyclic graphs with n vertices. Y. Hou obtained the minimum value on the energies of the graphs in G(n) and determined the corresponding graph in [10]. In this paper we give the second and third minimum values of the energies of graphs in G(n) and determine their corresponding graphs, respectively.
